data.title: Building (Useless) Chrome Extensions
data.subtitle: Inspired by Cloud-to-Butt, I wrote this talk to teach people how to make (useless) chrome extensions. These extensions involve photo replacement, text obfuscation, and link transformation.
data.name: chrome-extensions

data.title: Building iOS Apps with JavaScript and React Native
data.subtitle: React Native is a framework that allows you to build native mobile applications using JavaScript. I walk you through the key concepts by creating a simple search application.
data.name: react-native

data.title: ADI: Candidate for the Zvi Galil Award
data.subtitle: A presentation I wrote for ADI's application for the Zvi Galil Award (Engineering Student Group of the Year) at Columbia University. ADI ended up winning the award.

data.title: Leveling Up Your Apps with jQuery
data.subtitle: jQuery is one of the most widely-used JavaScript libraries. This talk teaches you how to utilize its features to make your websites interactive.
data.name: jquery

data.title: Making Your Website Pop
data.subtitle: Bootstrap is a useful CSS framework that makes styling web pages easy. Learn how to apply it. This talk was given as a part of ADI's high school teaching program.

data.title: How to Build a Website
data.subtitle: Learn how web pages are created in this talk. It teaches the basics of HTML and CSS. This talk was given as a part of ADI's high school teaching program.

data.title: Diving into iOS Development
data.subtitle: Build your first iOS application! This talk covers the basics concepts of iOS development while walking you through the creation of a simple quiz game.

data.title: Building Web Apps with Django
data.subtitle: This talk walks you through the basics of Django, one of my favorite web development frameworks. It walks through the main concepts, including MVC, templating, and URL schemes.
data.name: django

data.title: An Introduction to Python
data.subtitle: Never programmed before and want to learn? Python is a great starting point! Learn the basics of Python programming while completing simple tasks in this talk.
data.name: python
